frame.name: Weapon
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Weapon</fen> is an artifact created specifically to cause harm or damage. In some cases, a <fen>Use</fen>, <fen>Material</fen> of construction, <fen>Part</fen> or <fen>Type</fen> may be more narrowly specified.
<ex>Did you, or did you not, <gov>fire</gov> <x>this <fex name="Weapon"><t>gun</t></fex></x> with intent to harm my client?</ex>
<ex>Cyra tried to <gov>swing</gov> <x><fex name="Wld">her</fex> <fex name="Weapon"><t>sword</t></fex></x> to parry, but it was to heavy.</ex>
<ex>I investigated a specialist <x><fex name="Mat">precious metal</fex> <fex name="Weapon"><t>firearms</t></fex></x> <gov>manufacturer</gov>.</ex>
<ex>My neighbor, a member of the NRA since birth, has got an <fex name="Type">AK-47</fex> <fex name="Type">fully automatic</fex> <fex name="Use">assault</fex> <fex name="Weapon"><t>rifle</t></fex>.</ex>
<ex>Let 's just say that he 's the kind of guy who likes <t><fex name="Wep">guns</fex></t> <fex name="Part">with hair triggers</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Weapon
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity prototypically used by a <fen>Wielder</fen> to cause damage. <ex>They used to shoot these long-range <fex name="Wep"><t>rifles</t></fex> with scopes and hit targets a mile away.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root>The type of activity that the <fen>Weapon</fen> is generally involved in. Often this can be considered a kind of <fen>Type</fen> specification also. <ex>a <fex name="Use">dueling</fex> <t>pistol</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Use">anti-personnel</fex> <t>mines</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Use">deer</fex> <t>rifle</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates what subtype of the general category the <fen>Weapon</fen> belongs to. <ex>Most people don't keep <fex name="Typ">bastard</fex> <t>swords</t> in their livingrooms.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Wielder
FE.definition: <def-root>The person (or other sentient entity) that is using the <fen>Weapon</fen>. <ex>Reluctantly, he slid <fex name="Wld">his</fex> <t>guns</t> back into their holsters.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a part of the <fen>Weapon</fen>. This includes permanent, obligatory parts and mere attachments. <ex>I bought a <t>rifle</t> <fex name="Part">with a 2000-yard scope</fex>.</ex> <ex>They practiced on <t>swords</t> <fex name="Part">with wooden blades</fex> first.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>The term used to refer to an <fen>Weapon</fen>.
<ex>The <t>sword</t> <fex name="nam">Wirikidor</fex> was inadvertently cursed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which a <fen>Weapon</fen> comes into existence.
<ex>The <fex name="tim">fourth millennium BC</fex> <t>spear</t> has stimulated a lot of controversy.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or group responsible for the creation of the <fen>Weapon</fen>.
<ex><fex name="cre">Colt</fex> <t>pistols</t> are, for some reason, considerably more likely to be missold in this fashion.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description or characteristic of the <fen>Weapon</fen>.
<ex>He prefers to use a <fex name="Descriptor">heavy</fex> <t>bow</t> for long-distance combat.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rifle.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a gun with a long barrel in which spiral grooves are cut so as to cause the bullet to spin as it flies out

lexUnit.name: pistol.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small gun, designed to be fired with one hand

lexUnit.name: six-shooter.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a pistol with a revolving chamber holding six bullets

lexUnit.name: firearm.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rifle, pistol, or other portable gun.

lexUnit.name: gun.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon which fires projectiles at high velocity, usually metal bullets propelled by explosives burned within the barrel of the gun

lexUnit.name: cannon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a large-caliber, heavy gun

lexUnit.name: bomb.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a destructive device containing explosives, usually used in warfare

lexUnit.name: warhead.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: explosives, noxious chemicals, etc. mounted on a missile or artillery shell, usually with some triggering mechanism

lexUnit.name: sword.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a weapon with a long metal blade and a hilt with a handguard, used for thrusting or striking and often worn as part of ceremonial dress.

lexUnit.name: knife.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cutting instrument consisting of a blade fixed into a handle. NB: some instances of knives are meant to be weapons, others are meant to have a different purpose, such as cutting a particular substrate.

lexUnit.name: gat.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (slang) a pistol

lexUnit.name: AK-47.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a Soviet-designed rifle capable of semiautomatic and automatic fire.

lexUnit.name: grenade.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small bomb, thrown from the hand at an opponent simultaneously releasing a triggering device

lexUnit.name: crossbow.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a bow attached to a stock which holds the arrow, which is release by means of a trigger

lexUnit.name: machine-gun.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a gun designed to fire a series of bullets rapidly and automatically

lexUnit.name: shotgun.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a gun which fires many small pellets from a large cartridge

lexUnit.name: shooter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a gun.

lexUnit.name: flame-thrower.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon which shoots out a stream of burning liquid

lexUnit.name: weapon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a device intended to injure opponents or harm opponents' property in a conflict (offensive weapons) or to protect against such an attack (defensive weapons)

lexUnit.name: handgun.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a pistol

lexUnit.name: club.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a heavy rod, often having a thick end and a thinner handle, used as a weapon

lexUnit.name: twenty-two.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a twenty-two caliber rifle

lexUnit.name: forty-four.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a gun firing bullets whose diameter is 0.44 inches.

lexUnit.name: missile.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon consisting of a rocket carrying a warhead

lexUnit.name: garrotte.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon used for strangling the opponent, usually of cord or rope

lexUnit.name: revolver.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pistol with revolving chambers enabling several shots to be fired without reloading

lexUnit.name: weaponry.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a collection (or the general class) of artifacts used to inflict damage or harm.

lexUnit.name: Scud-B missile.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a mobile, liquid-fueled, single-stage missile of Russian design

lexUnit.name: arsenal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a store of weapons and ammunition

lexUnit.name: chemical weapon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon that produces its effect by the release of a toxic or noxious substance

lexUnit.name: ballistic missile.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a guided missile or rocket which can be steered only during the propulsion phase

lexUnit.name: biological weapon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon that produces its effect by the release of biological agents such as bacteria or viruses which cause disease in the targeted population

lexUnit.name: nuclear weapon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon deriving its destructive power from the rapid, uncontrolled release of nuclear energy

lexUnit.name: mustard gas.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a colourless oily liquid whose vapour is a powerful irritant and vesicant, used in chemical weapons

lexUnit.name: CW.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a (chemical) weapon that produces its effect by the release of a toxic or noxious substance

lexUnit.name: BW.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a (biological) weapon that produces its effect by the release of biological agents such as bacteria or viruses which cause disease in the targeted population

lexUnit.name: WMD.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: weapon of mass destruction

lexUnit.name: weapon of mass destruction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: weapons that are capable of a high order of destruction and/or of being used in such a manner as to destroy large numbers of people.

lexUnit.name: mine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a type of bomb placed on or in the ground or water, which detonates on contact

lexUnit.name: spear.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a metal weapon with a pointed tip and a long shaft, used for thrusting or throwing.

lexUnit.name: bow.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a long, thin resilient object fitted with a string and used to propel arrows.

lexUnit.name: explosive.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: Having a tendancy to explode.

lexUnit.name: explosive.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: substance, especially a prepared chemical, that explodes or causes explosion.

lexUnit.name: plastic explosive.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a putty-like explosive capable of being moulded by hand.

lexUnit.name: dynamite.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a high explosive consisting of nitroglycerine mixed with an absorbent material. [Chem]

lexUnit.name: nuclear.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: possessing or involving nuclear weapons

lexUnit.name: Scud-B.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a mobile, liquid-fueled, single-stage missile of Russian design

lexUnit.name: Scud-C missile.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a later version of the Scud-B missile; had extended range at the cost of greatdly reduced warhead size and accuracy

lexUnit.name: atomic weapon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon powered by nuclear reactions.

lexUnit.name: ordnance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mounted guns; cannon

lexUnit.name: arms.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: weapons; armaments.

lexUnit.name: artillery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: large-calibre guns used in warfare on land.

lexUnit.name: shell.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an explosive artillery projectile or bomb.

lexUnit.name: atomic bomb.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a bomb powered by nuclear reactions

lexUnit.name: biological.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: relating to, involving, or denoting the use of micro-organisms or toxins of biological origin as weapons of war.

lexUnit.name: chemical.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: relating to or denoting the use of poison gas or other chemicals as weapons of war.

lexUnit.name: nerve gas.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a poisonous vapour which disrupts the transmission of nerve impulses, causing death or disablement.

lexUnit.name: strategic.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of bombing or weapons) done or for use against an enemy's territory or infrastructure.

lexUnit.name: strategic nuclear weapon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weapon deriving its destructive power from the rapid, uncontrolled release of nuclear energy for use against an enemy's territory or infrastructure.

lexUnit.name: ICBM.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an intercontinental ballistic missile

lexUnit.name: RPG.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: rocket-propelled grenade.

lexUnit.name: rocket.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: explosive weapon fired at a target.

lexUnit.name: small arms.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: weapons typically used by infantry, including revolvers, rifles, and hand grenades.

lexUnit.name: EFP.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: explosively formed projectile (or penetrator).

lexUnit.name: assault rifle.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a rifle capable of automatic and semi-automatic fire with detachable magazine, or a rifle with similar design.

lexUnit.name: mortar.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a cannon with relatively shorter barrel used for hitting closer-range targets.

lexUnit.name: automatic weapon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A weapon capable of firing repeatedly as long as the trigger is held down.

lexUnit.name: C4.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a common type of plastic explosive

lexUnit.name: phosgene.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: carbonyl chloride, a colorless poisonous gas used as a chemical weaphon
